author: Special Correspondent
text:
Representatives of the DMK party’s legal wing lodged a complaint with the city police commissioner alleging that some AIADMK partymen had stuck posters across the city, tarnishing the image of DMK leaders.

The legal wing made the complaint on behalf of R.S. Bharati, DMK party organisation secretary. It asked the police that the persons behind these posters be brought to book.

“Even the Constitution of India does not provide limitless freedom of expression. Article 19 (2) imposes restrictions on such freedom, which specifically prevents an action inciting to an offence,” said the complaint.
title: DMK lodges complaint against posters
